meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unfeeling.
meanings.sent1: Her unfeelingness towards others made her seem cold and distant.
meanings.sent2: His unfeelingness was evident when he didn't offer any help to the injured person.
meanings.sent3: The unfeelingness of the robot was both impressive and slightly unsettling.
meanings.sent4: The unfeelingness of the stone wall reminded her of the harsh reality of life.
meanings.sent5: The unfeelingness of the storm made it seem even more powerful and unstoppable.

meanings.sent1: The unfeelingness in his eyes showed that he was not moved by her story.
meanings.sent2: Her unfeelingness towards the suffering of others was concerning.
meanings.sent3: The unfeelingness of the situation was almost comical in its absurdity.
meanings.sent4: The unfeelingness of the judge's decision left everyone shocked and speechless.
meanings.sent5: The unfeelingness of the mountain echoed the harshness of the environment.

meanings.sent1: His unfeelingness towards her feelings hurt her deeply.
meanings.sent2: The unfeelingness of his response showed a lack of empathy.
meanings.sent3: The unfeelingness of the cat ignoring its owner's calls was oddly amusing.
meanings.sent4: The unfeelingness of the empty room made her feel even more alone.
meanings.sent5: The unfeelingness of the desert landscape was both beautiful and eerie.
